0.title: I think I am going to be a yes mom: Sonam Kapoor to Anushka Sharma
0.article_body: Actress Sonam Kapoor, who is expecting her first child with husband Anand Ahuja, responded to Anushka Sharma's Instagram Stories and said that she will be a "YES Mom" for her child. Earlier, Anushka, taking to her Instagram Stories, asked, "How many times in a day do parents end up saying NO...Are you a yes parent or no parent?"

1.title: Alia shares note she received from Big B for 'Gangubai...' performance
1.article_body: Actress Alia Bhatt shared several of her selfies on Instagram on Monday. Among them, she shared a picture with a note she received from Amitabh Bachchan for her performance in 'Gangubai Kathiawadi'. "Alia, you are beyond magnificent in 'Gangubai Kathiawadi'," the note from Amitabh read. The veteran actor added that he is "short of words" to praise her performance.

2.title: Over 3,000 civilians killed due to Russia's invasion of Ukraine: UN
2.article_body: The UN human rights office on Monday said that the death toll of civilians killed in Ukraine since the start of the Russian invasion rose to 3,153. Citing access difficulties and ongoing corroboration efforts, it claimed that the real toll is likely considerably higher. Most of the victims were killed by explosive weapons with a wide impact area, it added.

3.title: Rajiv Ranjan replaces Mridul Saggar as MPC ex-officio member
3.article_body: The Board of Reserve Bank of India (RBI) on Monday approved the nomination of Executive Director Rajiv Ranjan as an ex-officio member of the monetary policy committee (MPC). Ranjan will replace Mridul Saggar, who is reportedly to retire by end of April. As per his LinkedIn profile, Ranjan was recently the head of the Department of Economic and Policy Research.

4.title: Du Plessis would be a bit jealous, jokes Gaikwad after record partnership with Conway
4.article_body: After registering the highest-ever partnership for CSK with Devon Conway, Ruturaj Gaikwad joked that his former CSK opening partner Faf Du Plessis would be a bit jealous. "It feels really nice to have this record. We didn't expect it. All we wanted was to start off really well [against SRH]," he added. Gaikwad and Conway shared a 182-run opening stand.

5.title: Maha Minister Nawab Malik hospitalised, condition serious: Lawyer
5.article_body: Maharashtra Minister Nawab Malik, arrested by the Enforcement Directorate in a money laundering case, was admitted to a Mumbai hospital as he was suffering from diarrhoea, vomiting, and fever for the last three days, his lawyer informed a court. The lawyer said the minister's condition was serious. The hospital said the minister is under observation at the Intensive Care Unit.

6.title: Practo elevates top executive Siddhartha Nihalani as Co-founder
6.article_body: Bengaluru-based healthcare company Practo on Monday announced the elevation of its long-term executive and growth head Siddhartha Nihalani to the position of Co-founder. With this, Nihalani will accompany other Co-founders, Shashank ND and Abhinav Lal, who were his batchmates at NIT Karnataka. Last year, ahead of its IPO, Zomato had elevated its ex-CFO Akriti Chopra to the Co-founder position.

7.title: 65-yr-old man strangled by 3 sons in Punjab over property dispute
7.article_body: A 65-year-old man was allegedly strangled to death by his three sons over a property dispute in Punjab's Fazilka on Monday. The accused used to often fight with the victim, Chinder Pal, who had disowned the trio, the victim's brother Jaswinder Singh said. The victim's body has been sent for postmortem and the accused are yet to be arrested.

8.title: MP man marries 3 partners at same time as per tribal customs
8.article_body: A 42-year-old man married his three live-in partners at the same function in accordance with tribal customs in Madhya Pradesh's Alirajpur district. Maurya informed PTI that he had got engaged to his first partner in 2003 and his two other partners have also been living with him over the past 15 years. His six children also participated in the rituals.

9.title: Pak may quash ex-PM Nawaz Sharif's conviction in graft cases: Report
9.article_body: Pakistani government may quash or suspend ex-PM Nawaz Sharif's conviction in graft cases to offer him chance to plead afresh before a court, Dawn reported. Minister Rana Sanaullah Khan said federal and Punjab's provincial governments can suspend accused's punishment who's been 'wrongly' sentenced. Sharif, convicted in two corruption cases in 2018, left for London in 2019 for medical treatment.

10.title: Japan, Thailand sign defence deal during PM Kishida's visit
10.article_body: During a visit to Thailand, Japanese PM Fumio Kishida and his Thai counterpart Prayut Chan-o-cha signed a defence agreement on Monday. The agreement would facilitate the transfer of defence hardware and technology from Japan to Thailand, according to Reuters. The deal was signed as Kishida wrapped up the last leg of a three-nation tour of Southeast Asia.

11.title: Denmark to destroy 11 lakh soon-to-expire doses of COVID vaccines
11.article_body: Denmark will destroy 11 lakh doses of COVID-19 vaccines because their expiration date is near, a government agency said on Monday. Denmark has a surplus of vaccines and efforts to donate them to developing countries have failed, it added. The epidemic in Denmark "is currently under control, and the vaccine coverage in the Danish population is high", it further said.

12.title: SBI gives no-dues certificate to farmer withheld over 31 paise
12.article_body: SBI on Monday told the Gujarat High Court that it has issued a no-dues certificate to a farmer after the court said not issuing the certificate over pending dues of 31 paise is "nothing but harassment". SBI added that it couldn't issue it earlier in view of a letter sent by the farmer asking it not to do so.

13.title: Power Grid to buy IL&FS Energy Development Company's CPTCL stake
13.article_body: State-owned Power Grid Corporation of India will purchase IL&FS Energy Development Company Ltd's (IEDCL) equity shareholding in Cross Border Power Transmission Company Ltd (CPTCL), as per a regulatory filing. Currently, Power Grid owns 26% stake in CPTCL while 38% shareholding is with IEDCL. Meanwhile, Satluj Jal Vidyut Nigam (SJVN) owns 26% and Nepal Electricity Authority owns 10% stake.

14.title: Claims of normalcy in J&K self-serving lies, contradictions: Mufti
14.article_body: Former Jammu and Kashmir Chief Minister Mehbooba Mufti on Monday said that claims of normalcy in the Union Territory by the Centre are "self-serving lies and contradictions"."Eid prayers are disallowed yet again in Jama Masjid tomorrow. Stripping people not only of their fundamental rights but also religious freedom symbolises their ruthlessness," she tweeted.

15.title: LIC IPO anchor book oversubscribed; gets bids of over ₹7,000 cr
15.article_body: The anchor investor portion of LIC initial public offering (IPO) was oversubscribed on Monday, the first day of subscription. Reports said the portion received bids in excess of ₹7,000 crore against the offer of ₹5,630 crore for anchor investors out of a total offer size of ₹21,000 crore. Investors likely to have bid include Norges Bank and GIC among others.

16.title: 18-yr-old Harshada wins India's 1st ever gold at junior world weightlifting championships
16.article_body: Harshada Sharad Garud has become the first-ever Indian to win a gold medal at the junior world weightlifting championships. Competing in 45kg category, the 18-year-old lifted a total of 153kg, including 70kg in snatch and 83kg in clean and jerk. Turkey's Bektas Cansu bagged the silver medal, while Moldova's Teodora-Luminita Hincu won the bronze medal in the event.

17.title: 'Paper-thin' loudspeaker that turns any surface into audio source made by MIT
17.article_body: Researchers at the Massachusetts Institute of Technology (MIT) have developed a "paper-thin" loudspeaker that can turn any surface into an active audio source. The loudspeaker weighs about as much as a dime and produces sound with minimal distortion. As per the researchers, the loudspeaker could be used like wallpaper to cover walls, cars, or aircraft interiors or for immersive entertainment.

18.title: Trump asked 'Can't you just shoot them?' amid protests: Ex-US official in book
18.article_body: Amid widespread 'Black Lives Matter' protests in Washington, former US President Donald Trump had asked, "Can't you just shoot them?", former Secretary of Defense Mark Esper has claimed. "Just shoot them in the legs or something?" Trump had reportedly asked, as per Esper who has revealed details about the time in his memoir.

19.title: Cong's Punjab in-charge recommends disciplinary action against Sidhu
19.article_body: All India Congress Committee (AICC) in-charge of Punjab Harish Chaudhary, in a written letter to Congress President Sonia Gandhi, sought disciplinary action against former Punjab Congress chief Navjot Singh Sidhu. In his letter, Chaudhary wrote Sidhu continued to criticise Congress, even as the party was contesting elections, adding that Sidhu had a "hand in glove with Shrimoni Akali Dal."

20.title: Check loudspeaker usage at religious places: BJP MP to Delhi LG
20.article_body: BJP MP from West Delhi Parvesh Sahib Singh on Monday requested Delhi Lieutenant Governor Anil Baijal, Delhi Police and MCDs to ensure loudspeakers installed at religious places are either removed, or used at permissible levels. The Uttar Pradesh government has followed the Supreme Court order appropriately, Verma said, adding, "The same needs to be done by other states as well."

21.title: 3-storey building in Nigeria's Lagos collapses, 8 dead
21.article_body: At least eight people were killed after a three-storey residential building collapsed in Nigeria's Lagos on Sunday, an emergency management official said on Monday. "Twenty-three people have been rescued alive including seven children and 16 adults," the official added. Rescue operations are ongoing to look for more people who might still be trapped under the rubble, the official further said.

22.title: 19-yr-old Priya beats Olympian Dutee in 200m at Khelo India University Games
22.article_body: Priya Mohan, representing Jain University, defeated Olympian and two-time Asian Games silver medallist Dutee Chand to win a gold medal in the women's 200 metres event at Khelo India University Games 2021 in Bengaluru on Monday. The 19-year-old clocked 23.90 seconds, while Dutee finished the race in 24.02 seconds. Earlier on Sunday, Priya won a gold in 400 metres.

23.title: Govt warns Google Chrome users of high-level threat, asks users to update browser
23.article_body: The government's Indian Computer Emergency Response Team (CERT-In) highlighted multiple vulnerabilities in Google Chrome for Desktop in a 'high-severity' warning. Google Chrome's version prior to 101.0.4951.41 is affected. Vulnerabilities allow a remote attacker to execute arbitrary code, obtain sensitive information and bypass security restrictions. CERT-In requested users to update the browser.

24.title: Director Parthiban throws mic at audience, AR Rahman's reaction viral
24.article_body: A video of music composer AR Rahman's reaction to director Parthiban throwing a mic at the audience during a song launch event for 'Iravin Nizhal' has gone viral on social media. Parthiban lost his cool and threw the mic at the audience after Robo Shankar asked him to pass the mic. He later apologised and cited pressure as the reason.

25.title: Fabindia gets SEBI's approval for raising funds through IPO
25.article_body: Lifestyle retail brand Fabindia has received market regulator SEBI's approval to raise funds through its IPO. According to Fabindia's draft red herring prospectus, its IPO includes fresh issue of shares worth upto ₹500 crore and an offer for sale of over 2.5 crore shares. The firm's promoters also plan to gift over seven lakh shares to artisans and farmers.

26.title: Eid is even more special with success of 'KGF 2': Sanjay Dutt's wife
26.article_body: Sanjay Dutt's wife Maanayata said this year's Eid will be more special for them because of the success of 'KGF: Chapter 2'. "All the love and support Sanjay received for his performance in the film," she stated. "Despite all the challenges...he powered through for the love of his fans...the success of the film reinstilled that love even more," she added.

27.title: Hope to shift our embassy back to Kyiv by May-end: US amid invasion
27.article_body: US expects to shift its embassy back to Kyiv by May-end if conditions are feasible, its charge d'affaires said on Monday. US diplomats had departed from Kyiv embassy weeks before the Russian invasion of Ukraine began and had relocated some of its functions to Lviv, before shifting to Poland. Countries including UK and Hungary have reopened their embassies in Kyiv.

28.title: Hopeful to play vs Nadal on my 19th birthday at 2022 Madrid Open: Alcaraz
28.article_body: Talking about his potential match against Rafael Nadal on his 19th birthday at 2022 Madrid Open, world number nine Carlos Alcaraz said he's hopeful to play on Thursday provided he wins on Tuesday. "It's a special day...hopefully I'll be able to win this year," he added. Alcaraz had lost to the fellow Spaniard on his birthday in Madrid last year.

29.title: Would love to come to India to meet 1st Indian superhero: Benedict
29.article_body: 'Doctor Strange' actor Benedict Cumberbatch has said he would like to come back to India and meet the first Indian superhero. "I love India, I love your...cultures," he stated. Benedict had spent six months in India's Darjeeling to teach English at a Tibetan monastery. "I'd love...to come back...if that's to interact with the first Indian superhero," the British actor stated.

30.title: Choksi pledged fake gemstones to secure ₹25 cr loan from govt-run IFCI: CBI
30.article_body: Fugitive diamantaire Mehul Choksi used "low-quality, lab-prepared chemical vapour diamonds" and other 'fake gemstones' to secure a ₹25 crore corporate loan from government-run IFCI, CBI has alleged. After his company, Gitanjali Gems, defaulted on the loan, it was found that their actual valuation was 98% less than shown by the company. He's accused of cheating IFCI of ₹22 crore.

31.title: It can happen: Sehwag on CSK qualifying for IPL 2022 playoffs under Dhoni
31.article_body: Virender Sehwag has said CSK can reach the playoffs in IPL 2022 under MS Dhoni following his reappointment as skipper. CSK beat SRH by 13 runs to register their first win under Dhoni's captaincy on Sunday. Overall, it was their third win from nine matches. He added that Dhoni-led India have won many matches which they used to lose before.

32.title: Ukraine may lose millions of tonnes of grain due to blockade: Prez
32.article_body: Ukrainian President Volodymyr Zelenskyy on Monday said that Ukraine could lose tens of millions of tonnes of grain due to Russia's blockade of its Black Sea ports. "Russia wants to completely block our country's economy," he added. This could trigger a food crisis that will affect Europe, Asia and Africa, Zelenskyy claimed.

33.title: Political crisis in Maha, won't give them an inch of land: K'taka CM
33.article_body: Karnataka Chief Minister Basavaraj Bommai on Monday urged politicians of Maharashtra not to use border issues for their political survival, adding that the state will not give an inch of its land. "The politicians of Maharashtra raise the border and language issue whenever they face a political crisis in their state," he said.

34.title: India believes no one will win Russia-Ukraine war: PM Modi in Germany
34.article_body: India believes that no one will be victorious in the ongoing Russia-Ukraine war, PM Narendra Modi said in Germany on Monday. Peace talks are the only way to resolve the Ukraine crisis, he added. "Recent geopolitical incidents have shown that world peace and stability are in critical condition and showed how all countries are interconnected," said PM Modi.

35.title: Germany pledges €10 billion for bilateral cooperation with India
35.article_body: German Chancellor Olaf Scholz on Monday said Germany is pledging €10 billion (approximately ₹80,615 crore) for bilateral cooperation with India in the coming years. "When implementing the measures for these partnership projects, we will provide a great deal of funding over the next few years," Scholz said. This comes after PM Narendra Modi held talks with Scholz in Berlin today.

36.title: Taj Mahal entry to remain free for 2 hours for offering namaz on Eid
36.article_body: Entry to the Taj Mahal will remain free for two hours on the occasion of Eid-ul-Fitr for offering namaz at the mosque on its premises from 7 am to 9 am on Tuesday. Taj Mahal gates had remained closed for namaz on Eid in 2020 and 2021, because of restrictions and curbs imposed during the COVID-19 pandemic.

37.title: AAP expels leader for pro-Khalistan tweets, says it backs India's unity
37.article_body: AAP has expelled its Himachal Pradesh unit leader Harpreet Singh Bedi over his alleged pro-Khalistan tweets. The move came after BJP accused Bedi of supporting Khalistan cause, citing his past tweets which allegedly included demand for new currency for Khalistan. "AAP...believes in...unity & integrity of [India]...& [won't] tolerate anyone writing anything against our country," the party tweeted.

38.title: PIL seeks regulation of polygamy by Muslim men; HC asks Centre's view
38.article_body: Delhi HC on Monday asked the Centre to submit its stand on a Muslim woman's PIL seeking regulation of polygamy practiced by Muslim men. The PIL sought polygamy without the present wife's written consent be declared unconstitutional and illegal. It also sought adequate arrangements for the existing wife's accommodation and maintenance be made before allowing a man to practice polygamy.

39.title: Restaurant staff attack customers after complaint over food taste in Noida
39.article_body: Two people were hospitalised after being allegedly attacked by the staff of a restaurant in UP's Noida after they complained about the taste of cold coffee and shake that they ordered. The complainant Shailendra Pal said the restaurant's owner abused him and his two friends after their complaint. He allegedly called his staff who attacked Shailendra's friends with a knife.

40.title: Germany ready to back EU ban on Russian oil imports: Minister
40.article_body: Germany's ready to support a gradual EU-wide ban on Russian oil imports, Foreign Minister Annalena Baerbock has said. Baerbock's comment came after fellow minister Robert Habeck said that the country could be completely independent of Russian crude oil supply by end of summer. Notably, Germany has been top buyer of Russian energy since Ukraine's invasion began, a study recently claimed.

41.title: U'khand limits number of pilgrims for Char Dham Yatra starting May 3
41.article_body: The Uttarakhand government has capped the number of pilgrims during the Char Dham Yatra starting May 3 (Tuesday). Only 15,000 pilgrims will be allowed to visit the Badrinath Temple per day and the daily limit for the Kedarnath Temple is 12,000. It is 7,000 for Gangotri and 4,000 for Yamunotri shrine.

42.title: SpiceJet flight turbulence matter being dealt with deftness: Scindia
42.article_body: Union Aviation Minister Jyotiraditya Scindia on Monday said the turbulence encountered by SpiceJet's Mumbai-Durgapur flight is being dealt with "utmost seriousness and deftness". He said that the damage caused to the passengers is "unfortunate", adding that the Directorate General of Civil Aviation has deputed a team to investigate the incident.

43.title: New Zealand-founded IT company offers unlimited leave to employees
43.article_body: New Zealand-founded IT company Actionstep is offering its employees unlimited annual leave, The New Zealand Herald reported. "This way, it covers everything like sick leave, bereavement and maternity," Actionstep's VP of engineering, Stevie Mayhew, said. "We're a team, we trust each other and we believe our best work happens when life & work is in good balance," the company said.

44.title: India hits a century in style: Goyal as Open becomes India's 100th unicorn
44.article_body: Union Minister of Commerce & Industry Piyush Goyal tweeted, "India hits a century in style," after Bengaluru-based neo-banking platform Open became India's 100th unicorn. Open raised $50 million at a valuation of $1 billion in a Series D funding round led by IIFL, Moneycontrol reported. Six months ago, Open raised $100 million led by Google, Temasek, Visa, and SoftBank Investments.

45.title: Training, arming doesn't make Germany party to war in Ukraine: Govt
45.article_body: Germany will not become a party to the Russia-Ukraine conflict because it provides training to Ukrainian soldiers, German government spokesperson Steffen Hebestreit said. The possibility of Ukraine striking Russian territory with weapons it had received from NATO countries would not change this, he added. Last month, Germany had approved the delivery of anti-aircraft tanks to Ukraine.

46.title: Hopeful of things progressing in right direction at Madrid Open: Djokovic
46.article_body: Top seed Novak Djokovic said he's hopeful that things will progress in the right direction at Madrid Open 2022 after his runner-up finish at Serbia Open a few days ago. The world number one added that he has to be positive about his recent result. He further said he's yet to achieve his desired level of play.

47.title: Critic gave bad review to Sarfarosh due to issues with Aamir: Director
47.article_body: 'Sarfarosh' director John Matthew Matthan revealed that a critic gave a negative review to his film after watching it for just the first half because he had issues with Aamir Khan. "He was a total dictator. He saw only half of Sarfarosh. He walked out as he had issues with Aamir since [he] wouldn't attend his award functions," he added.

48.title: Shami told LSG pacer Mohsin that he's better than him: Coach Siddiqui
48.article_body: Revealing what Mohammad Shami told Mohsin Khan some time ago, the LSG pacer's coach Badruddin Siddiqui said, "Shami told him that Mohsin is a better bowler than him but just needed more focus." He added, "I called him during lockdown and said, 'learn whatever you can from Shami'." Playing in his debut IPL, Mohsin has taken eight wickets so far.

49.title: Spanish PM, Defence Minister's phones targeted with Pegasus spyware
49.article_body: The Pegasus spyware was detected on mobile phones of Spanish PM Pedro Sánchez and Defence Minister Margarita Robles Fernández, the Minister for the Presidency, Félix Bolaños García, said on Monday. Sánchez's mobile phone was breached twice in May 2021 and Fernández's device was targeted once the following month, he added. "We've no doubt...this is an...unauthorized intervention," he further said.

50.title: 2 SpiceJet flight passengers in ICU after being injured during turbulence
50.article_body: Two passengers of the SpiceJet Mumbai-Durgapur flight who were injured during severe turbulence on Sunday, have been admitted to ICU, DGCA said on Monday. A total of 14 people were injured when the flight got caught in turbulence during descent. The injuries occurred due to cabin luggage falling on them.

51.title: KKR to bowl first against RR, Venkatesh Iyer dropped
51.article_body: KKR captain Shreyas Iyer won the toss and elected to bowl first against RR in their IPL 2022 clash on Monday. Venkatesh Iyer has been dropped by KKR and he has been replaced by Anukul Roy. KKR have also included Shivam Mavi in their playing XI. Karun Nair has replaced Daryl Mitchell in RR's playing XI.

52.title: Salary was low but I survived: Naukri.com Founder on 1st job with ₹1,000 stipend
52.article_body: Naukri.com Founder Sanjeev Bikhchandani took to Twitter to share the offer letter he received for his first job at the advertisement company Lintas in 1984. He was offered the role of an Executive Trainee with a monthly stipend of ₹1,000. "The salary was low but I survived," Bikhchandani tweeted, adding that the "learning was great and the relationships were lifelong".

53.title: KKR's dressing room has opposite energy to GT, it's negative: Pietersen
53.article_body: Ex-England captain Kevin Pietersen has criticised Kolkata Knight Riders for their ongoing campaign in the IPL 2022. Taking to his blog, Pietersen wrote, "For a franchise as big as KKR, it's just a horrible state of affairs." "That is a dressing room full of the opposite energy to Gujarat: negative," he added. KKR have lost six out of nine matches.

54.title: Apple charged by EU antitrust regulators over mobile payments tech
54.article_body: European Commission on Monday charged Apple for restricting rivals' access to its Near-Field Communication (NFC) technology used for mobile payments. "The Commission's preliminary view is that [Apple]...restricts competition by reserving access to NFC technology to Apple Pay," the Commission said. EU regulators had last year accused Apple of distorting competition in the music streaming market.

55.title: PM Modi holds talks with German Chancellor on bilateral cooperation
55.article_body: PM Narendra Modi held talks with German Chancellor Bundeskanzler Olaf Scholz on bilateral cooperation in Berlin. The meeting was held prior to the sixth round of Biennial Inter Governmental Consultations between India and Germany. This is their first engagement since Chancellor Scholz assumed office in December 2021, the Ministry of External Affairs said.

56.title: No doubt they have to give Benzema the Ballon d'Or 2022: Perez
56.article_body: Real Madrid president Florentino Perez has opined that forward Karim Benzema should win the Ballon d'Or this year. "There is no doubt that they have to give him the Ballon d'Or this year, they can't take it away," Perez stated. Benzema is the top scorer in this year's La Liga with 26 goals and Champions League with 14 goals.

57.title: 5 injured as structure at construction site collapses in Pune
57.article_body: A structure erected for laying a slab at an under-construction building collapsed in Wanawadi area of Pune on Monday, injuring five workers who were trapped under it. Around 25 labourers were working to lay the slab on the first floor of the building. The fire brigade's teams reached the spot and rescued the workers.

58.title: Himachal will implement UCC soon, move won't harm Muslims: CM
58.article_body: Himachal Pradesh CM Jairam Thakur said on Monday that the state will implement Uniform Civil Code (UCC) soon, adding that the move won't harm the Muslim community. "I think everyone especially Muslim women will welcome this step...It will be beneficial for them," he added. Neighbouring Uttarakhand decided to set up a panel comprising of experts to draft UCC last month.

59.title: Imran Khan took away ₹6 cr BMW while leaving PM's office: Pak minister
59.article_body: Pakistan's Information Minister Marriyum Aurangzeb has claimed that former PM Imran Khan has retained an official vehicle worth PKR 150 million (around ₹6.17 crore). Khan allegedly took a BMWX5, belonging to the PM Office's fleet for foreign delegations, while leaving the top office. He insisted on keeping the car even after criticising previous governments for expensive cars, Aurangzeb said.

60.title: Delhi sees 6,194 MW peak power demand, highest-ever in May 1st week
60.article_body: Delhi's peak power demand on Monday clocked 6,194 MW at 3:34 pm, which is the highest ever peak demand recorded in the first week of May. Last month too, Delhi saw a peak of 6,197 MW, an all-time high for the month of April. India's energy demand reached an all-time high of 2,07,111 MW on Friday, the Power Ministry said.

61.title: Haryana changes school timings to 7am-12 noon amid scorching heat
61.article_body: The Haryana government has changed the timings of government and private schools from May 4 (Wednesday) due to scorching heat conditions in the state, as per an official order. The schools will now open from 7 am to 12 noon, it said. All district magistrates have been asked to ensure compliance of the government order.

62.title: Nearly half of Elon Musk's Twitter followers are fake: Report
62.article_body: Nearly 48% of Elon Musk's 87.9 million Twitter followers are fake, TIME Magazine reported citing Twitter auditing tool SparkToro's data. These accounts are "unreachable and will not see Musk's tweets, either because they're spam, bots, propaganda, or because they're no longer active on Twitter," SparkToro said. Last month, Musk struck a deal to buy Twitter for $44 billion.

63.title: UPI hits record high transactions worth ₹9.83 lakh crore in April
63.article_body: Unified Payments Interface (UPI) recorded 5.58 billion transactions in April 2022, a new all-time high for the payments platform since its launch in 2016, NPCI data revealed. In value terms, UPI saw transactions worth ₹9.83 lakh crore in April. This is a 3.3% jump in volume of transactions from March 2022 and a rise of 111% on a year-on-year basis.

64.title: Delhi replaces Dubai as world's 2nd busiest airport in March: Report
64.article_body: Delhi's Indira Gandhi International Airport was the world's second busiest airport in March in terms of domestic and international flights, travel data provider Official Airline Guide (OAG) said in a report. While Atlanta retained its first position, Dubai slipped to third. The report said Atlanta, Delhi and Dubai airports handled 4.42 million, 3.61 million and 3.55 million seats respectively.

65.title: Delhi records 1,076 new COVID-19 cases & no death, positivity rate at 6.4%
65.article_body: Delhi on Monday reported 1,076 new COVID-19 cases in the last 24 hours, as compared to 1,485 cases recorded on Sunday. The national capital also saw 1329 recoveries and zero deaths in the last 24 hours. The city's daily positivity rate was at 6.42% on Monday as compared to Sunday's 4.89%.

66.title: Karauli incident on Ram Navami was an experiment by BJP: Raj CM
66.article_body: Rajasthan CM Ashok Gehlot on Sunday said that violence cannot be the answer to violence and what happened in Karauli on Ram Navami was "an experiment by the BJP". "The RSS and BJP have decided to divide this country between Hindus and Muslims, between religions, castes. This is part of their agenda and this is just the beginning," he said.

67.title: T’gana ministers inaugurate electronics manufacturing unit in Hyd
67.article_body: Telangana IT Minister KT Rama Rao and Education Minister Sabitha Reddy inaugurated a manufacturing unit of Radiant Appliances & Electronics at Raviryala's e-city in Hyderabad on Monday. The plant, which has been set up with an investment of ₹100 crore, will generate additional employment for 1,000 people. "25% of India’s TVs will now be manufactured from Hyderabad," KTR tweeted.

68.title: BJP lists AAP's 'failures' in Delhi after 7 years of being in power
68.article_body: BJP on Sunday listed the alleged failures of the Aam Aadmi Party government in Delhi, which has been in power for the past seven years in the city. Delhi BJP chief Adesh Gupta said that CM Kejriwal opened only 200 mohalla clinics and Leader of Opposition Ramvir Singh Bidhuri said that 63% of people don't get DJB filtered drinking water.

69.title: Gadkari pitches for priority lending for alternative fuels sector
69.article_body: Union Minister Nitin Gadkari on Monday said firms involved in production or business of alternative fuels should be included in priority sector lending. "I shall speak about the issue with the Finance Minister and RBI Governor," Gadkari said. Priority sector lending will help such businesses to obtain loans from banks on easier terms, Gadkari added.

70.title: UP minister Girish Yadav hospitalised after suspected rat bite during tour
70.article_body: UP minister Girish Chandra Yadav was on Monday bitten by a rat or a mole rat during his visit to Banda, following which he felt uneasy and was taken to a hospital. He was fine and left for Lucknow later. A bite mark of a rat or mole rat was found on his right-hand finger, the Chief Medical Superintendent said.

71.title: Don't perform 'Maha Aarti' on May 3: Raj Thackeray to MNS workers
71.article_body: MNS chief Raj Thackeray on Monday appealed to his party workers to not perform 'Maha Aarti' on loudspeakers on May 3 so that no social tension is created during the Eid festival. "The loudspeaker issue is not a religious matter but a subject of public interest. What further needs to be done, I will inform tomorrow," Thackeray added.

72.title: BMC to work to boost Mumbai's last-mile connectivity: Maha Minister
72.article_body: The Brihanmumbai Municipal Corporation (BMC) will work to make at least one road in each of the 24 administrative wards pedestrian-friendly to boost the last-mile connectivity, according to Maharashtra Minister Aaditya Thackeray. This will be done under a pilot project, he said. Notably, the BMC maintains about 2,100 kilometres of roads in the administrative wards.

73.title: To aspire to be like IPL, is useless & has no logic: Salman Butt on PSL
73.article_body: Ex-Pakistan skipper Salman Butt, speaking about PSL, said, "To develop animosity with players or aspire to be like IPL, is useless and has no logic behind it." He added, "Both leagues take care of their players well enough...nobody has complained about the PSL." Butt stated that it is "pointless" to compare the financial side of any league with the IPL.

74.title: Winning game more important than 99 or 100: Gaikwad on getting out at 99
74.article_body: After falling one run short of a century against SRH in IPL 2022, CSK opener Ruturaj Gaikwad said he was a little sad. "But I was happy that I was able to gain momentum and take...pressure off Devon Conway. Whether it's 99 or 100, winning the game is important," he added. CSK beat SRH by 13 runs on Sunday.

75.title: Pic of Mithun in hospital surfaces, son says he was admitted due to kidney stones
75.article_body: A picture of veteran actor Mithun Chakraborty resting on a hospital bed surfaced online, with his fans expressing concern about him. His son Mimoh, however, revealed that the 71-year-old actor was hospitalised in Bengaluru due to kidney stones recently but has been discharged now. "He (Mithun) is fit and fine," said a report quoting Mimoh.

76.title: 176 dancers, singers perform non-stop for 12 hrs at an event in Pune
76.article_body: As many as 176 singers, musicians and dancers performed continuously for 12 hours at the 21st Brahmanad Sangeet Mahotsav in Pune's Dhayari. The event featured dance forms such as Bharatnatyam, Kathak and Odissi. In music, it featured Natya Sangeet, Tappa, Thumri, Tarana, Bada Khayal and Chota Khayal.

77.title: Govt lists 'danger signs' in people that require medical attention amid heatwave
77.article_body: The Ministry of Health in its advisory for citizens amid the heatwave listed 'danger signs' to observe in adults and children, that require immediate medical attention. Hot, red and dry skin and core body temperature ≥40°C are some of the 'danger signs' to be observed in adults. Among kids, indicators like decreased urine output and dry oral mucosa were listed.

78.title: Ukrainian drones destroy Russian patrol boats in Black Sea, video released
78.article_body: Authorities in Ukraine on Monday said its drones destroyed and sank two Russian patrol boats near the Black Sea's Snake Island. Sharing a video of the same, the Ukrainian Defence Ministry said that the vessels were Raptor boats. The footage shows an explosion resulting from the attack on one of the boats.

79.title: Ruturaj should be drafted into the Indian Test team: Vengsarkar
79.article_body: Former India cricketer Dilip Vengsarkar has said that CSK opening batter Ruturaj Gaikwad should be drafted into India's Test side. "Ruturaj handled Umran Malik upfront...The way Ruturaj played the speedster's fast deliveries, especially the short ones, should make the selectors happy," Vengsarkar said. "Indian players, of late, have found pace and bounce impossible to tackle," he said.

80.title: Drunk man rescued by police after he climbs tower in Hyderabad
80.article_body: Two police officials from Hyderabad's Tukaramgate police station rescued an inebriated man who climbed atop a tower for hoardings in the city. A video of the incident was shared by police online. According to police, the man, identified as Narsing Rao, had climbed the tower to die by suicide but was brought down in time and counselled by the officials.

81.title: Kohli, Ronaldo are two similar brands: Kevin Pietersen
81.article_body: Former England captain Kevin Pietersen has said that cricketer Virat Kohli and footballer Cristiano Ronaldo are "two similar brands". "What he (Kohli) needs to do is to have a look at...Ronaldo. Two similar brands in their different teams and in their sports. You have Kohli right at the top of cricket...Ronaldo is right at the top of football," Pietersen said.

82.title: Raj Thackeray's speech was divisive, police will decide action: Minister
82.article_body: Maharashtra Minister Dilip Walse Patil has said that MNS leader Raj Thackeray's recent speech in Aurangabad on loudspeaker controversy was divisive. "Police will listen to his speech...decide what's objectionable and...decision will be taken," he added. Thackeray has warned that if loudspeakers aren't removed from all mosques in state, Hanuman Chalisa will be played at a louder volume from May 4.

83.title: Very unfair: Nadal on Wimbledon banning Russian & Belarusian players
83.article_body: Former world number one tennis player Rafael Nadal has termed Wimbledon organisers' decision to ban Russian and Belarusian players from this year's tournament as "very unfair". "They (players) aren't to blame for what is happening with the war. I feel sorry for them...When the government puts measures in place, we have to follow them," Nadal said.

84.title: Karun Nair plays me best among all Indian batters: Trent Boult
84.article_body: Rajasthan Royals pacer Trent Boult has revealed that he thinks fellow RR colleague Karun Nair plays him the best among all Indian batters. "I haven't bowled Karun Nair in a game, but he has the ability to put any kind of ball I throw to him at the nets. So, at the moment, I would say Karun Nair," Boult said.

85.title: I was scared to death to be on 'Friends', Courteney helped a lot: Tom Selleck
85.article_body: Actor Tom Selleck said that he was scared to death to be on the show 'Friends'. "The hardest thing is to guest on a show...Courteney helped a lot...But that group's an incredible group of friends. They obviously became friends in life as well as on the show. And it shows. It was a wonderful place to work," he added.

86.title: I’ve seen Ratna Pathak perform in films, she's absolute magic: Ranveer
86.article_body: Ranveer Singh, who's working for the first time with actress Ratna Pathak Shah in 'Jayeshbhai Jordaar', said that he has only admiration for the veteran actor. "Ratna ma'am's kids used to be in my school. She used to always be around during dramatics and annual day," he added. "I've seen her perform on television, in films...She's absolute magic," Ranveer said.

87.title: Fire burns down L1 wine shop in Gurugram, no casualties reported
87.article_body: A fire burned down the L1 wine shop in Gurugram's Golf Course Road, according to reports. The shop caught fire around 12:10 pm and two fire tenders were rushed to the spot. The fire was doused in half an hour, officials said, adding that no casualties were reported. The fire could've been caused by a short circuit, an officer said.

88.title: Sri Lanka extends credit line with India by $200 million for fuel
88.article_body: Sri Lankan Power Minister Kanchana Wijesekera on Monday said Sri Lanka has extended a credit line with India by $200 million in order to procure emergency fuel stocks. Sri Lanka is in talks to extend the credit line by an additional $500 million, Wijesekera said at a press conference. Previously, India sent nearly 76,000 MT of fuel to Sri Lanka.

89.title: Wikimedia Foundation stops accepting crypto donations after eight years
89.article_body: The Wikimedia Foundation (WMF), which hosts Wikipedia, has announced that it will no longer accept donations in cryptocurrency. The WMF said it will also close its BitPay account, "which will remove our ability to directly accept cryptocurrency as a method of donating". The decision comes eight years after the organisation first began accepting donations in Bitcoin, Bitcoin Cash, and Ether.

90.title: I played Mohsin in the nets, then didn't want to face him: KL Rahul
90.article_body: LSG captain KL Rahul called their pacer Mohsin Khan "brilliant" as the 23-year-old picked four wickets against DC, helping them win by six runs. Rahul added, "I played Mohsin in the nets a month ago, [then] didn't want to face him...He was sharp, he's scary at times in the nets. It's not just the pace, he has a good brain."

91.title: Maha CM inaugurates replica of Shivaji Maharaj's fort in Mumbai
91.article_body: A replica of Chhatrapati Shivaji Maharaj's fort near Mumbai international airport was inaugurated by Maharashtra CM Uddhav Thackeray on Sunday. A statue of Chhatrapati Shivaji Maharaj was also installed at replica fort. Notably, Thackeray didn't touch on political issues while speaking at the function and said that he would address them at a political rally on May 14 in Mumbai.

92.title: PMC to now offer staff free housing in gardens' residential areas
92.article_body: Pune Municipal Corporation (PMC) has decided to provide free accommodation to Garden Department staff who want to stay in the residential areas in its gardens. The order, however, stated that the staff would have to pay for their water and electricity charges. The PMC had not been paying house rent allowance to employees staying in its gardens so far.

93.title: Idli seller held for possessing whale puke, worth ₹5 crore, in Mumbai
93.article_body: An Idli seller was arrested by Mumbai Police for allegedly possessing 2 kg of whale vomit worth ₹5 crore. The accused, identified as Shendu Raman Shrinivasan, had taken a loan for his idli shop and wanted to pay off his debts through the money from the sale of whale vomit, the officials of the Aarey Police Station said.

94.title: Salim was a good actor, skin phobia came in way of his success: Shyam Benegal
94.article_body: Filmmaker Shyam Benegal said that late actor Salim Ghouse was a good actor but "skin phobia" came in the way of his success in commercial Hindi cinema. "We suffer from a massive colour prejudice. We boast of plurality in skin pigmentation. But when it comes down to actual facts we suffer from a massive skin phobia," he added.

95.title: I was banned from the film industry after #MeToo movement: Kangana
95.article_body: Actress Kangana Ranaut recently revealed in 'Lock Upp' that she was banned in the film industry after she came out in support of the #MeToo movement. "The women who had come forward with accusations, they have all vanished from the face of the planet," she added. "I was banned from the industry, while the women I supported disappeared," Kangana said.

96.title: Alcaraz doesn't have to look at me anymore, he's a star already: Nadal
96.article_body: Rafael Nadal said tennis player Carlos Alcaraz is already a star. "He doesn't have to look at me anymore. He's a star already. He's doing amazing things," Nadal stated. Alcaraz recently won the Barcelona Open after beating Pablo Carreño Busta. "Happy about being a fan of tennis that we're going to have an amazing player for...a long time," Nadal added.

97.title: Ex-IAS officer Tarun Kapoor appointed Advisor to PM Narendra Modi
97.article_body: Former Petroleum Secretary Tarun Kapoor has been appointed as the Advisor to PM Narendra Modi, the government said on Monday. The 1987-batch retired IAS officer has been appointed for a period of two years from the joining date, the order said. Hari Ranjan Rao and Atish Chandra have been appointed as Additional Secretaries in the PM's office.

98.title: Dhoni had so much support towards the end of his career, they took him to WC: Yuvraj
98.article_body: Ex-India all-rounder Yuvraj Singh stated that several players including him, Harbhajan Singh, Gautam Gambhir and Virender Sehwag didn't get support from team management towards the end of their careers. He added, "Look at MS Dhoni. He had so much support from Virat Kohli and Ravi Shastri...They took him to World Cup. He went on to play 350 games."

99.title: 'Doctor Strange in the Multiverse...' earns ₹20 cr in pre-booking in India
99.article_body: Marvel Studios' 'Doctor Strange in the Multiverse of Madness', starring Benedict Cumberbatch and Elizabeth Olsen, has reportedly earned ₹20 crore in advance ticket bookings in India. As per reports, it has surpassed the advance booking numbers of 'Spider-Man: No Way Home'. Directed by Sam Raimi, 'Doctor Strange in the Multiverse of Madness' is set to release on May 6.

100.title: Hope my stardom & fan following will help me bag me some films: Karan
100.article_body: During a press conference, actor Karan Kundrra said that although he is dubbed as "the king of TRPs and star on television, he has a lot to achieve". "Even on the web show 'Lock Upp'...we had 5.2 million people watching live at 1 am," he said. "I hope my stardom and fan following help me bag some films," he added.

101.title: Kohli still comes to the gym with child-like enthusiasm: RCB fitness coach Basu
101.article_body: RCB's strength and conditioning coach Shanker Basu has revealed that Virat Kohli still comes to the gym "like a child". "The enthusiasm hasn't come down even one per cent. In fact, it has only gone up," he stated. "Virat is mainly...trying to build muscle mass. T20 also requires a lot of explosive energy; force production is a byproduct," added Basu.

102.title: If batters attack him, he'll attack them back: Ojha on RR's Chahal
102.article_body: Praising Yuzvendra Chahal, ex-India cricketer Pragyan Ojha said the more one challenges the RR leg-spinner, the better he comes out. "If batters attack him, he'll not go on the defensive, he'll attack them back," he added. In RR's last match against KKR, Chahal conceded 17 runs in his first over before claiming a hat-trick. He finished with figures of 5/40.

103.title: Kejriwal must visit RSS shakhas to learn about nationalism: BJP leader
103.article_body: BJP leader Parvesh Sahib Singh invited Delhi CM Arvind Kejriwal to visit the RSS headquarters to "learn about nationalism". "Nationalism must be in our heart and mind. We know how nationalist he is. He raises questions about surgical strikes and opposes 'The Kashmir Files'. What about the riots that happened under his government in Delhi and Patiala," he said.

104.title: Odisha to build 1000 bridge-cum-dams to boost drinking water sources
104.article_body: The Odisha government to build 1000 more bridge-cum-weirs (low dams) across the state, senior officials said. These low dams, which will be constructed within three years, will function to boost the state's drinking water and irrigation sources, officials said. Notably, the state government have earlier built such structures and their impact was found positive, senior officials said.

105.title: SRH coach Steyn takes CSK captain Dhoni's autograph, pic goes viral
105.article_body: A picture of SunRisers Hyderabad (SRH) fast bowling coach Dale Steyn taking Chennai Super Kings (CSK) captain MS Dhoni's autograph after their IPL 2022 match on Sunday has gone viral. "GOAT recognises GOAT," a fan commented. "Steyn might be taking it for someone," another fan wrote. "Biggest legends in world cricket," another tweet read.

106.title: MyPillow's millionaire CEO rejoins Twitter, banned again after 3.5 hours
106.article_body: American firm MyPillow's multi-millionaire CEO Mike Lindell was banned from Twitter on Sunday, 3.5 hours after making a return to the platform. Lindell, a supporter of ex-US President Donald Trump, was banned from Twitter in January 2021 for spreading misinformation about the 2020 election. Twitter said Lindell's account was permanently suspended for violating the platform's rules on ban evasion.

107.title: Russian gas supply to Europe via Ukraine hits 5-month high
107.article_body: The Russian gas supply to Europe through Ukraine via the Slovakian border point of Velke Kapusany hit a five-month record high on Monday, according to Slovakian operator TSO Eustream. Daily nominations for gas deliveries stood over 9.9 lakh megawatt hours, the highest since November 30. This comes despite calls for boycott of Russian fuel in Europe over Ukraine war.

108.title: 'Chalo Ayodhya' posters put up in Mumbai ahead of Raj Thackeray's visit
108.article_body: Maharashtra Navnirman Sena has put up 'Chalo Ayodhya' posters in Mumbai, appealing to people to join party chief Raj Thackeray on his visit to Ayodhya in Uttar Pradesh on June 5. Amid the ongoing loudspeaker row, Thackeray on Sunday warned that if they aren't taken down, then 'Hanuman Chalisa' would be played with double volume from May 4.

109.title: Wanting to frame people from village, UP man gets friend to rape wife
109.article_body: In a bid to frame some people from his village, a man allegedly got a friend to rape his wife in Uttar Pradesh. The man took his 22-year-old wife to a forest on Sunday. His friend also came to forest and raped his wife twice. The man then called police and told them two people had sexually assaulted his wife.

110.title: Which are the world's top 15 places for long-term remote workers as per a research?
110.article_body: Lisbon is the best location for long-term remote workers, research by real estate services company Savills, listed on the London Stock Exchange, said. Lisbon is followed by Miami, Dubai, Algarve, Barbados, Barcelona, Dubrovnik, Saint Lucia, Malta, Antigua, Mauritius, Côte d'Azur, Cyprus, Tuscany and The Bahamas. "They offer favourable climates year-round and a high quality of life," Savills said.

111.title: WhatsApp banned more than 18 lakh Indian accounts in March 2022
111.article_body: WhatsApp banned 18.05 lakh accounts in India in March 2022, the platform said in its latest monthly compliance report. The accounts were banned on the basis of complaints received from users and through WhatsApp's own mechanism to prevent and detect violations. WhatsApp also detailed the user complaints it received during the month and the corresponding action it took against them.

112.title: Vicky, Kiara and Bhumi's 'Govinda Naam Mera' release postponed: Report
112.article_body: The release dates of Vicky Kaushal, Kiara Advani and Bhumi Pednekar's 'Govinda Naam Mera' and Sidharth Malhotra and Rashmika Mandanna's 'Mission Majnu' have been postponed. "Some...work is remaining, and there's also an event Hollywood film, 'Jurassic World', up for release, so [they're] in no hurry to bring their...projects," report stated. Both the films were slated to release on June 10.

113.title: I would choose to marry her 'all over again': Bill Gates on ex-wife Melinda
113.article_body: Microsoft Co-founder Bill Gates has said that he would choose to marry ex-wife Melinda "all over again". "From my point of view it was a great marriage. I wouldn't have changed it. You know, I wouldn't choose to marry someone else," he added. The pair announced their decision to divorce in May 2021 after nearly 30 years of marriage.

114.title: Fresh case against Mehul Choksi for cheating IFCI of ₹22 cr during 2014-2018: CBI
114.article_body: The CBI said it has filed a fresh case against fugitive diamantaire Mehul Choksi and his Gitanjali Gems for allegedly cheating government-run IFCI Limited of ₹22 crore between 2014 and 2018. Choksi allegedly approached IFCI seeking financial support for Gitanjali Gems and got it to sanction a ₹25 crore corporate loan in 2016. The company allegedly defaulted on loan repayments.

115.title: US First Lady to meet Ukrainian refugees during Romania, Slovakia trip
115.article_body: US First Lady Jill Biden will visit Romania and Slovakia from May 5-9 and meet Ukrainian refugees, along with US service members and embassy personnel during her trip, her office confirmed on Monday. Jill will also meet humanitarian workers and teachers working with displaced Ukrainian children. Her trip follows US House Speaker Nancy Pelosi's recent visit to Kyiv.

116.title: Electricity issues to be resolved within 10 days: Haryana CM
116.article_body: Speaking about the power crisis in Haryana, CM Manohar Lal Khattar on Sunday said the power-related issues will be resolved within next 10 days. "We've already provided 24-hour electricity to 5,600 villages and 800 are next…The power demand has increased by 50% as compared to the last year and of this, 30% has been fulfilled by state government," Khattar added.

117.title: Will give PKR50,000 to anyone who rips off ex-minister Rashid's wig: Pak PM's aide
117.article_body: Special assistant to Pakistan Prime Minister Shehbaz Sharif, Hanif Abbasi, has said that anyone who rips off and brings former Interior Minister Sheikh Rashid's wig will be rewarded PKR50,000. Abbasi said former Prime Minister Imran Khan, Rashid and his nephew were involved in planning the incident in Saudi Arabia's Masjid-e-Nabawi in which the Sharif delegation was insulted.

118.title: Daryl Mitchell hasn't quite shown the player that he is: Vettori
118.article_body: Former New Zealand captain Daniel Vettori has said Daryl Mitchell could be the all-rounder RR are looking for if he's given a few more chances in the tournament. "Daryl hasn't quite shown the player that he is," added Vettori. Daryl played in RR's last two games and scored 17(20) and 16(24) without taking wickets in his two overs.

119.title: 12 arrested from B'luru in Karnataka police recruitment exam scam
119.article_body: As many as 12 people from Bengaluru have been arrested by the Crime Investigation Department in connection with last year's police sub-inspector recruitment exam in Karnataka. These people are said to have cleared the recruitment examination. A fresh FIR has listed 22 candidates from Bengaluru as accused in the scam.

120.title: B'luru underpass floods due to rain; disrupts traffic for 3 hrs
120.article_body: Traffic was disrupted for almost three hours after the Okalipuram underpass got waterlogged due to heavy rainfall in Bengaluru on Sunday. At least 46 electric polls either fell or were damaged and a transformer failed in the district amid the heavy downpour. A traffic police station also took to Twitter to urge people to be safe while driving.

121.title: Live hand grenade recovered from Army jawan's bag at Srinagar airport
121.article_body: A live hand grenade was allegedly recovered from an Army jawan's baggage during screening at the Srinagar airport on Monday, officials said. The jawan, a resident of Tamil Nadu, has been detained, the officials added. The jawan was scheduled to travel to Chennai via Delhi by an Indigo flight.

122.title: Katrina is a great influence in my life; I learn from her every day: Vicky
122.article_body: Actor Vicky Kaushal said that his wife, actress Katrina Kaif has been a great influence in his life. "I'm very fortunate to have found a life partner in her because she's an extremely wise, intelligent, and compassionate person," he added. "I learn a lot from her every single day," he said. Vicky got married to Katrina in December last year.

123.title: Israel calls Russian minister's Hitler comment 'anti-semitic', seeks apology
123.article_body: Israel's Foreign Ministry on Monday denounced Russian Foreign Minister Sergei Lavrov's "Hitler had Jewish blood" remark, terming it 'anti-semitic' and demanded an apology from Moscow. The ministry also summoned Russian Ambassador for "tough talk". Lavrov in an interview drew comparison between Ukrainian President Volodymyr Zelenskyy and Nazi leader Adolf Hitler over latter's alleged Jewish roots.

124.title: Audi, Porsche have decided to join Formula 1: Volkswagen CEO
124.article_body: Volkswagen's premium brands Audi and Porsche have decided to join Formula One, Volkswagen CEO Herbert Diess confirmed on Monday. Porsche's preparations are a little more concrete, Diess, speaking on YouTube, added. It comes after Reuters reported in March that Audi is ready to offer $556.30 million for British luxury sports carmaker McLaren as a means to enter.

125.title: 9-year-old girl raped by uncle at a brick kiln in UP's Bijnor
125.article_body: A nine-year-old girl was raped by her uncle (18) in Shivala Kalan village in Bijnor, Uttar Pradesh. According to the police, the accused works as a labourer at a brick kiln site. Notably, the incident took place when the victim’s parents had gone to work at the same brick kiln site, police said.

126.title: Musk is visionary, he'll make Twitter open to diverse views: Zoho CEO
126.article_body: Zoho's billionaire CEO Sridhar Vembu told ET Now that Elon Musk is a "great visionary" who will make Twitter more open to diverse viewpoints. Vembu said, "[Debates] have been particularly one-sided on Twitter...it is similar to the Cultural Revolution period of China." He added that both Musk and he are against the "cancel culture" rampant on Twitter.

127.title: The board, not any individual investor, suspended the CEO: Zilingo
127.article_body: Singapore-based startup Zilingo said the decision to suspend its Indian-origin Co-founder and CEO Ankiti Bose was taken jointly by the board and not by any individual investor. "Following her suspension...Bose brought to the board’s attention, for the first time, certain harassment-related allegations," Zilingo said. No investor was made aware of Bose's claims prior to her suspension, it added.

128.title: Australian man admits he pushed gay American off cliff in 1988
128.article_body: A 51-year-old Australian man, Scott White, admitted that he pushed a 27-year-old gay American mathematician Scott Johnson off a Sydney cliff which killed him in 1988. The prosecutors have described it as a gay hate crime. "I pushed a bloke. He went over the edge," White was heard saying in a recorded police interview which was played in a court.

129.title: Direct investment in equities hit 6-month low in March
129.article_body: Direct retail investment in the equity market through the National Stock Exchange stood at ₹7,100 crore in March, the lowest inflow in more than six months, data showed. The net inflows from retail investors were down 49% month-on-month in March.  The dip came despite addition of over 9 million dematerialised accounts in the March quarter, data further revealed.

130.title: Vijay Babu steps down from Malayalam artistes' body after sexual assault case
130.article_body: Malayalam actor-producer Vijay Babu, who has been accused of sexually assaulting a woman, has decided to step down from the executive committee of the Association of Malayalam Movie Artistes (AMMA). "Vijay Babu...[said]...he didn't want to bring disgrace to the organisation," AMMA said. Vijay appeared in a Facebook live session recently and claimed innocence, saying he's the "real victim".

131.title: Buttler starts afresh every game, hasn't taken his form for granted: Nick Knight
131.article_body: Ex-England cricketer Nick Knight has praised RR opener Jos Buttler, who's currently the highest run-scorer in IPL 2022, stating that the 31-year-old is "starting afresh" in every game in the tournament. "Buttler hasn't taken his form for granted at all. He's giving himself a few balls to get in and then [he] plays those big shots," added Nick.

132.title: Film took 3 yrs to complete as Aamir had signed other films: Sarfarosh director
132.article_body: 'Sarfarosh' director John Matthew Matthan said the film took three years to complete because Aamir Khan had signed three films and his dates kept getting pushed. "This was one of the...reasons why Aamir decided to not work in multiple films at a time," he added. "Every time I'd be geared up to shoot, the schedule would get pushed," he said.

133.title: Thieves & robbers made ₹303 crore in Mumbai in last 4 yrs: Report
133.article_body: Thieves and robbers in Mumbai made ₹303.79 crore in the last four years, according to The Indian Express. Valuables and cash collectively worth ₹69.13 crore were lost to thieves and robbers in 2021 alone. Notably, the police were able to recover ₹163.24 crore of the ₹460.48 crore in valuables and cash stolen or robbed by criminals during the same period.

134.title: Shilpa shares video of her working out on a bus, fan calls her 'inspirational'
134.article_body: Shilpa Shetty took to Instagram to share a video of her working out in an empty bus on her way to her flight at an airport. "Monday motivation on the go...only because the bus was empty...Squeezed in some pull-ups, push-ups, and lunges on my way back home," she wrote. Several people praised Shilpa, with one writing, "You're truly an inspiration."

135.title: Which are the five fastest balls in IPL 2022 so far?
135.article_body: SunRisers Hyderabad (SRH) fast bowler Umran Malik has bowled the fastest delivery in IPL 2022 so far. He clocked 154 kmph twice in SRH's match against CSK on Sunday. GT fast bowler Lockie Ferguson's 153.9-kmph delivery against CSK is the third-fastest delivery of IPL 2022. It is followed by Umran's 153.3 and 153.1-kmph deliveries against GT and CSK, respectively.

136.title: U'khand to introduce Bhagavad Gita, Ramayana in schools: Minister
136.article_body: Uttarakhand will include Bhagavad Gita, Ramayana and Vedas in the school curriculum, state Education Minister Dhan Singh Rawat said on Monday. He added that Uttarakhand is the first state to implement the National Education Policy (NEP). Apart from introducing Gita in schools, the history of Uttarakhand will also be taught to students, the minister added.

137.title: Pant guiding Kuldeep just the way MSD did: Kuldeep's childhood coach
137.article_body: Kuldeep Yadav's childhood coach Kapil Dev Pandey said Delhi Capitals skipper Rishabh Pant is doing what MS Dhoni used to do with Kuldeep. "Pant is guiding Kuldeep the way Dhoni did...He is guiding him from behind the stumps," he stated. Kuldeep has taken 17 wickets in nine matches so far. "They're on the same page about most things," Kapil added.

138.title: We aren't going in game focussing on just Buttler: Russell ahead of KKR-RR
138.article_body: Ahead of KKR-RR match in IPL 2022, KKR all-rounder Andre Russell said the franchise aren't solely focussing on current leading-scorer Jos Buttler. "Because if it's not his [Buttler] day, we can't get him out cheaply, celebrate big and pretend that we have won the game," he added. He further said Buttler "hurt" them in their last encounter, scoring 103(61).

139.title: Rampant corruption in Haryana, people forced to pay bribes: AAP leader
139.article_body: AAP leader Sushil Gupta stated that rampant corruption is going on in all departments in Haryana and people are being "forced" to pay bribes to get their works done. "Corruption, crime and unemployment have been soaring in the state," Gupta added. He further said that corruption is rampant in Haryana with the "support" of ministers.

140.title: Punjab announces recruitment to 26,454 posts, approves ration delivery scheme
140.article_body: The Punjab Cabinet on Monday gave its approval for recruitment to 26,454 posts in various departments in the state. The Cabinet has also approved one MLA-one pension and door-to-door ration delivery schemes, Chief Minister Bhagwant Mann announced. He added that compensation of ₹41.8 crore has been approved for soft crop failure in Sri Muktsar Sahib.

141.title: Mask for cows to neutralise their methane emissions wins award in UK
141.article_body: A wearable mask for cows to neutralise their methane emissions in real-time is one of the four winners of the inaugural Terra Carta Design Lab competition in the UK. Created by UK-based design group Zelp, the mask captures methane with each burp. A catalyst oxidises the gas and releases it into the atmosphere as carbon dioxide and water vapour.

142.title: To-be captain Jadeja should've been involved in mega auction: Irfan
142.article_body: Irfan Pathan said MS Dhoni leaving his CSK captaincy for Ravindra Jadeja two days before the start of IPL 2022 was a surprise. "Because if Dhoni had made up his mind to leave the captaincy, to-be captain Jadeja should've been involved in...[mega] auction," he added. "If Dhoni's exit was a last-moment decision...means Jadeja wasn't involved in the auction," he said.

143.title: South Korea reopens embassy in Ukraine’s Kyiv
143.article_body: South Korea on Monday reopened its embassy in Kyiv, which was shut following Russia's attack on Ukraine. The Kyiv embassy was evacuated and two temporary liaison offices were established in Ukrainian cities of Lviv and Chernivtsi after the war started. The South Korean Foreign Ministry said it intends to work with the local government to protect its citizens in Ukraine.

144.title: 2 sisters, Zomato agent die as car hits divider in Delhi, flips 4-5 times
144.article_body: A speeding car rammed into a motorbike and crashed into iron railing of a road divider in Delhi on Sunday, before flipping four to five times. Two sisters aged 17 and 19 and a food delivery agent wearing Zomato t-shirt was killed in incident. Eyewitnesses said sisters fell out of rear windows of car when it was flipping over.

145.title: You'll waste life on court dates: Mumbai Mayor to MNS on loudspeaker issue
145.article_body: MNS workers should not take the law into their hands, "otherwise their life will be wasted attending court dates", said Mumbai Mayor Kishori Pednekar in response to MNS chief Raj Thackeray's loudspeaker ultimatum. "Loudspeakers will be removed from temples and mosques...No one, including Muslims, opposed Hanuman Chalisa," she said. Loudspeakers must be used as per noise pollution rules, she added.

146.title: Sundar re-injured his hand vs CSK, it had an impact on our bowling: Tom Moody
146.article_body: SRH coach Tom Moody confirmed that all-rounder Washington Sundar, who had earlier missed three games due to split webbing in his bowling hand, suffered an injury on the same hand against CSK. "It's not injured to the point that it [needs] re-stitching...but, it wasn't in a state where he could bowl," stated Moody. "It really had an impact," he added.

147.title: I wish to start my own venture with my money, won't go to investors: Ashneer
147.article_body: BharatPe's former Managing Director Ashneer Grover at a recent event said, "I wish to start my own venture with my own money and make it profitable." Grover termed his tussle with the fintech startup as a "badly fought corporate battle". He also said that he does not want to go back to the investors again when starting his new venture.

148.title: Police took my sister to a room, I later found her hanging: UP gangster's daughter
148.article_body: After elder daughter of gangster Kanhaiya Yadav was found dead following a police raid at his house in UP, his younger daughter said, "Two women police personnel & 8-10 male personnel took my sister to a room and beat her. They left after half an hour." "I entered the room & saw her hanging from ceiling fan," she added.

149.title: Conspiracy against me designed by PMO: Jignesh Mevani
149.article_body: Gujarat MLA Jignesh Mevani on Monday said it was a "pre-planned conspiracy" to "destroy" him. "You're using a woman to lodge FIR against me. This is a conspiracy designed by the PMO in view of the upcoming Gujarat Assembly elections," Mevani stated. Earlier, an Assam court granted bail to Mevani in a case of alleged assault on a policewoman.

150.title: So what if Zelenskyy is Jewish, Hitler also had Jewish blood: Lavrov
150.article_body: Russian Foreign Minister Sergei Lavrov on being questioned about his country's President Vladimir Putin's call to "denazify" Ukraine, replied, "So what if [Ukrainian President Volodymyr Zelenskyy] is Jewish? The fact does not negate the Nazi elements in Ukraine." "I believe that Hitler also had Jewish blood," he said. Lavrov said this during an interview with Italian news channel Zona Bianca.

151.title: Balasaheb told Advani 'if Modi is removed, you'll lose Guj' after 2002 riots: Uddhav
151.article_body: Maharashtra CM Uddhav Thackeray has revealed that after the 2002 post-Godhra riots in Gujarat, his late father Balasaheb Thackeray supported PM Narendra Modi (then the state's CM). There was a demand to remove PM Modi as Gujarat CM then, Uddhav said, adding, "Balasaheb told (LK) Advani...'Modi shouldn't be touched. If Modi is removed, (the BJP) will lose Gujarat'."

152.title: Debates on Uniform Civil Code will bear constructive outcome: Naqvi
152.article_body: Union Minister Mukhtar Abbas Naqvi said on Monday that holding debates on Uniform Civil Code (UCC) will bear constructive outcome for the country. "UCC is not being introduced for the first time in the world, our constitution-makers said that we must move towards adopting [it]," he added. Naqvi's comments come amid proposed implementation of UCC by Uttarakhand, among other states.

153.title: No ban on selling meat in Bengaluru tomorrow: Civic body on rumours
153.article_body: The Bruhat Bengaluru Mahanagara Palike (BBMP) has denied rumours that there will be a ban on sale of meat in the city on Tuesday, when Eid will be celebrated, since the festival clashed with Basava Jayanti. A senior BBMP official said the Urban Development Board hasn't marked Basava Jayanti as a day when there is a moratorium on selling meat.

154.title: Markaz Nizamuddin mosque to stay open beyond Ramzan for 1st time since 2020
154.article_body: For the first time since 2020, the mosque at the Markaz Nizamuddin has been granted permission by the Delhi High Court to open beyond Ramzan as well. Notably, this is the first time since March 2020 that such permission has been granted to the Masjid Bangley Wali. The mosque will remain open till October 14, advocate Wajeeh Shafiq said.

155.title: After Taare Zameen Par's success, I was bullied in school: Darsheel
155.article_body: Actor Darsheel Safary revealed after the success of his film, 'Taare Zameen Par', he had to face bullying in school where he was surrounded [by kids] and his clothes were pulled. "I had to take...half-day to save myself," Darsheel said. He added that recently several people came up to him and were under the impression that he had quit acting.

156.title: Salman is quite excited about No Entry 2, it's an extremely funny film: Anees
156.article_body: Filmmaker Anees Bazmee has said that Salman Khan is quite excited about 'No Entry 2', a sequel to his 2005 film. "The scripting of 'No Entry 2' is complete and I've narrated it to Salman, who loved the film...It's a nicely written and an extremely funny film," he added. Anil Kapoor and Fardeen Khan will also return for the sequel.

157.title: Finch doesn't want to play left-arm seamers at all: Piyush Chawla
157.article_body: Cricketer-commentator Piyush Chawla has criticised KKR for changing their openers frequently in the ongoing IPL season. Chawla suggested that KKR should open with Ajinkya Rahane and Venkatesh Iyer, stating, "Aaron Finch doesn't want to play left-arm seamers at all". KKR, who are eighth on the IPL points table, will play their 10th game in the tournament against RR on Monday.

158.title: Mumbai airport to remain shut for maintenance for 6 hours on May 10
158.article_body: Mumbai's Chhatrapati Shivaji Maharaj International Airport (CSMIA) will remain shut from 11:00 am to 5:00 pm on May 10 for pre-monsoon maintenance work, a statement from CSMIA said. The airport has advised all passengers to check the May 10 flight schedules with their respective airlines to avoid inconvenience. "The runway closure is a yearly practice," CSMIA's statement said.

159.title: 502 metres long Surkanda Devi Temple ropeway inaugurated in U'khand
159.article_body: Uttarakhand Chief Minister Pushkar Singh Dhami on Sunday inaugurated the ropeway service from Kaddukhal to the Surkanda Devi temple in the state's Tehri district. Reports said that the ropeway is 502 metres long and can ferry up to 500 people every hour. Dhami said that the ropeway would create more jobs and benefit the tourism sector in the state.

160.title: WWII Victory Day on May 9 won’t impact Ukraine operation: Russia
160.article_body: Russia will commemorate Victory Day, which marks the end of World War II, on May 9 in a solemn manner and it won't impact the military operation in Ukraine, said Foreign Minister Sergei Lavrov. "Our soldiers won't base their actions on a specific date," he said on being asked if the day would mark a turning point in Ukraine conflict.

161.title: India's unemployment rate rises to 7.83% in April, Haryana tops list: Report
161.article_body: The unemployment rate in India rose to 7.83% in April 2022 from 7.60% in March 2022, according to data from the Centre for Monitoring Indian Economy (CMIE). The highest unemployment rate of 34.5% was recorded in Haryana. It's followed by 28.8% in Rajasthan, 21.1% in Bihar, 15.6% in Jammu & Kashmir, 15.5% in Goa and 14.6% in Tripura.

162.title: Gave Jadeja full control after 2 matches, spoon-feeding doesn't really help: Dhoni
162.article_body: Talking about Ravindra Jadeja's captaincy in IPL 2022, CSK skipper MS Dhoni suggested he gave full control to Jadeja after the latter's first two matches as captain. Dhoni added that he took care of fielding angles and gave more information to Jadeja in the first two matches, but stopped doing that thereafter. "Spoon-feeding doesn’t really help the captain," Dhoni stated.

163.title: Tiger ripped his pants during Heropanti 2 shoot; Thank God we had more: Ahmed
163.article_body: 'Heropanti 2' director Ahmed Khan said that actor Tiger Shroff ripped his pants and suits during the film's shoot. "Even if we gave Tiger an eight-way stretching elastic material, it would wear off. The suit and pants would tear in rehearsals itself. Thank God we had more ready." "Tiger [had] gone all full swing, splits and back-flips," Ahmed said.

164.title: Maximum temp likely to fall by 2-4°C over Northwest, Central India during next 3 days: IMD
164.article_body: The IMD has said that maximum temperature is likely to fall by 2-4°C over most parts of Northwest and Central India during the next three days. It added that the temperature will likely rise after three days. "No significant change in maximum temperatures over Gujarat and Maharashtra during next 2 days and rise by about 2°C thereafter," it stated.

165.title: Don't know what captain, management are thinking: RP Singh on KKR
165.article_body: Ex-India pacer RP Singh has criticised KKR over changes in their batting order in IPL 2022. "Venkatesh Iyer had been moved from top to the middle-order. He's back [as] opener...now. Nitish Rana has also been moved up and down the order. No batter is getting a settled position," explained Singh. KKR have lost six of their nine games so far.

166.title: 'Prithviraj' is my dream project, lived with this story for 18 yrs: Director
166.article_body: Dr Chandraprakash Dwivedi, the writer-director of the upcoming film 'Prithviraj' starring Akshay Kumar, has said he lived with this story for 18 years before deciding to make it into a film with Aditya Chopra. "[It's] my dream project," he said, adding, "There's no Samrat like Prithviraj in our history...and I hope our film is a fitting tribute to his valour."

167.title: Balasaheb told Advani that Modi shouldn’t be removed as Guj CM: Uddhav
167.article_body: Maharashtra Chief Minister Uddhav Thackeray has said that Balasaheb had told LK Advani to "not remove Narendra Modi from the post of Gujarat Chief Minister". "Balasaheb told Advani ji then that Modi should not be touched. If Modi was removed, (the BJP) will lose Gujarat and that Hindutva will suffer because of it," he added.

168.title: Neobank startup Open becomes India's 100th unicorn with new funding
168.article_body: Neobank startup Open on Monday announced that it has entered the unicorn club with a new funding round that values it at $1 billion. With this, the Bengaluru-headquartered startup has become India's 100th unicorn. The Series D funding round was led by IIFL and saw participation from existing investors Tiger Global, Temasek and 3one4 Capital, Open said.

169.title: Neutralised Russian agents were planning to attack passenger plane: Ukraine
169.article_body: Ukrainian Parliament on Sunday claimed that its security forces neutralised Russian "saboteurs" who were planning a terrorist attack in which they'd shoot down a passenger plane over Russia or Belarus. The attackers were going to "unjustifiably" accuse Ukraine and its allies of the attack, it alleged. "The enemy sabotage group consisted of two dual citizens and an accomplice," it said.

170.title: Methane emissions from cows' burps observed from space for 1st time; pic released
170.article_body: Methane emissions burped up by cows have been observed from space for the first time, environmental data company GHGSat said as it released a satellite picture. The company's analysis confirmed that the emissions came from a cattle feedlot in California's Joaquin Valley. As cows digest their food, they release methane, mostly through their gassy burps.

171.title: LSG mentor Gambhir hurls abuse in joy & celebrates aggressively against DC, video viral
171.article_body: A video has gone viral on social media showing LSG mentor Gautam Gambhir hurling an abuse in joy and celebrating aggressively during their win against DC in IPL 2022 on Sunday. "The Gautam Gambhir we all know," a fan tweeted reacting to the video. LSG defeated DC by six runs and are currently placed second on the points table.

172.title: PM's misgovernance spanning 8 yrs is a case study: Rahul on inflation, power crisis
172.article_body: Congress leader Rahul Gandhi on Monday said that PM Narendra Modi's "misgovernance" spanning eight years is a case study. "Power crisis, jobs crisis, farmer crisis, inflation crisis - PM Modi's eight-years of misgovernance is a case study on how to ruin what was once one of the world's fastest-growing economies," Gandhi tweeted.

173.title: All parties should work together in this direction: Raghav Chadha on coal shortage
173.article_body: Moving apart from politics, all parties should work together towards the coal shortage issue, AAP leader Raghav Chadha said. "Not just one or two states but 16 states of the country are facing a huge coal shortage and electricity crisis," Chadha added. "Coal, Railway and Power Ministries should work under PM's leadership," Chadha stated.

174.title: AAP has Khalistani mentality people: Gujarat BJP chief CR Paatil
174.article_body: After Delhi CM Arvind Kejriwal called Gujarat BJP chief CR Paatil a "non-Gujarati", the latter responded by alleging that AAP has members with a "Khalistani mentality". "Giving responsibility in his party to people with Khalistani mentality and believing that making a demand for Khalistan is a constitutional right, Arvind Kejriwal is a threat to security of the country," Paatil tweeted.

175.title: You're my icon: Girl after PM Modi asks why she made his portrait during Germany visit
175.article_body: A video showing PM Narendra Modi interacting with a girl who made his portrait during his Germany visit has surfaced online. The PM asked the girl, "Why did you make this?" to which she replied, "Because you are my icon." The girl can be heard telling the PM that she spent an hour drawing the portrait.
