352.article_body: Amid Indonesia's palm oil export ban, the Centre said India has enough stock of edible oil. The present stock of all edible oils is around 21 lakh metric tonne (LMT) and another 12 LMT will arrive in May, the government added. Edible oils' prices are being watched closely so that appropriate measures can be taken to keep prices under control.

353.title: Video shows tornado ripping through Kansas in US; hundreds of buildings destroyed
353.article_body: A video shows a tornado ripping through parts of Kansas in US. The tornado destroyed hundreds of homes and buildings, injured several people and left more than 15,000 people without power, officials said. Moreover, three University of Oklahoma meteorology students traveling back from storm chasing in Kansas were killed in a crash, according to officials.

354.title: It will redefine the action genre for Indian cinema: Kangana on 'Dhaakad'
354.article_body: Kangana Ranaut, speaking about her upcoming film 'Dhaakad', said it will redefine the action genre for Indian cinema. "It has been...long-standing dream of mine to take up challenging parts and be part of movies that change the norm," she added. Kangana, who plays the lead role in the film, further said she enjoyed playing agent Agni "who stops at nothing".

355.title: 2 govt employees beaten with sticks by villagers in UP
355.article_body: Two employees of the Uttar Pradesh Power Corporation Limited were allegedly beaten with sticks by villagers of Takia village, Budaun on Sunday. The two employees, identified as Fukran Hussain and Nafees Ahmed, had gone to the village to rectify a faulty line, police said. Incidentally, on Friday, an SP MLA allegedly assaulted a UPPCL employee in the district as well.

356.title: KSRTC waives off over 7,000 employee disciplinary cases on Labour Day
356.article_body: As many as 7,200 employee disciplinary cases of Karnataka State Road Transport Corporation (KSRTC) were waived off on Sunday on the occasion of International Labour Day, a statement by KSRTC read. "Employees who were absent from duty for less than ten months are exempted from...disciplinary proceedings," it added. Fines ranging between ₹100 and ₹500 have been levied on these employees.

357.title: Mumbai man kills friend for asking to return money, dumps body in water
357.article_body: Mumbai Police have arrested a 22-year-old man for strangulating his 18-year-old friend using a cable wire after she asked him to return the money she had lent to him. The man packed her body in a sack and threw it in the water at Madh beach. He had asked for a friend's scooter to take the body to the beach.

358.title: Pakistan govt channel fails to cover PM's event, 17 of its employees fired
358.article_body: Seventeen employees of Pakistan's state-run PTV channel have been fired for failing to cover PM Shehbaz Sharif's event in Lahore last week. PTV reportedly failed to ensure "proper" coverage due to the non-availability of an advanced laptop for uploading the video footage. The sacked employees reportedly said they were 'scapegoated' by the administration appointed by Pakistan's previous regime.

359.title: Andy Cohen welcomes baby girl via surrogacy, shares pic
359.article_body: American television talk show host Andy Cohen took to his social media handles to announce that he has welcomed a baby girl via surrogacy. Sharing a picture of his daughter, the 53-year-old wrote, "Meet my daughter, Lucy Eve Cohen! Thank you to my rock star surrogate (ALL surrogates are rockstars, by the way) and everyone who helped...make this miracle happen."

360.title: Stuart Broad & I were hoping our careers weren't over: James Anderson
360.article_body: Veteran England pacer James Anderson has opened up about the England cricket board's Managing Director Rob Key's statement that Anderson and Stuart Broad could feature for England this summer. "Stuart and I were hoping our careers weren't over," he stated. "Because of the situation...you're just...unsure of what's going to happen. So now having that clarity is really nice," he added.

361.title: I haven't been home for 9 years: MI debutant Kumar Kartikeya
361.article_body: Spinner Kumar Kartikeya, who made his debut for MI against RR on Saturday, revealed he hasn't been home for nine years. "I'd decided to return home only when I achieve something in life. My mom and dad called me frequently, but I was committed. Now finally I'll return home after...IPL," the 24-year-old, who represents Madhya Pradesh in domestic cricket, said.

362.title: Upto ₹10,000 fine, jail for those plying unfit vehicles in Delhi
362.article_body: Delhi's Transport Department said owners and drivers of vehicles, including those of government departments, found plying without a valid fitness certificate could be fined upto ₹10,000 or be jailed. They could be fined between ₹2,000-5,000 for first offence and ₹5,000-10,000 for subsequent offences. Vehicle owners will also have to pay renewal fee for their vehicle's certificate of registration.

363.title: TN medical college students administered Charak oath; notice issued
363.article_body: Tamil Nadu's Directorate of Medical Education has issued a notice and sought an explanation after first-year students at Madurai Government Medical College were administered the Charak oath instead of the Hippocratic oath on Saturday. An official release said that this was "strongly condemnable". The dean of the state-run college was also relieved of his post and put on a waitlist.

364.title: Multiple Grammy Award winner Naomi Judd dies of mental illness at 76
364.article_body: American singer and actress Naomi Judd, a five-time Grammy award winner, passed away on Saturday at the age of 76. "We lost our beautiful mother to the disease of mental illness. We are shattered," her daughter Ashley Judd said in a statement on Twitter. Mourning her demise, American singer-songwriter Carrie Underwood said, "Country music lost a true legend."

365.title: Carolina Marin wins her 6th European Championships title
365.article_body: Former world number one shuttler Carolina Marin won her sixth European Championships title after beating Kirsty Gilmour of Scotland by 21-10 and 21-12 on Saturday. The 28-year-old shuttler, who made her comeback after a gap of ten months, said, "I feel extremely happy...Being able to come back and play my first tournament of the season is bigger."

366.title: Delhi-NCR 9th most costly office market in Asia-Pacific: Report
366.article_body: Delhi-NCR is the ninth most expensive prime office space market in Asia-Pacific with an occupancy cost of $60 per square feet per year, Knight Frank's Asia-Pacific Prime Office Rental Index for Q1 2022 revealed. The region's most expensive office markets are Hong Kong ($186) and Singapore ($105). Mumbai ($50.9) and Bengaluru ($26.7) are at 15th and 21st positions respectively.

367.title: EMIs to rise as HDFC hikes lending rate on housing loans
367.article_body: Mortgage lender HDFC has increased its Retail Prime Lending Rate (RPLR) on housing loans, on which its Adjustable Rate Home Loans (ARHL) are benchmarked, by 5 basis points. The hiked rate, which will increase EMI for existing borrowers, comes into effect from May 1, 2022, HDFC Ltd said. There is no change in the lending for new borrowers.

368.title: My 23rd b'day was very special, I signed my debut film with JP Dutta: Abhishek
368.article_body: Abhishek Bachchan in an interview spoke about his 23rd birthday and said, "[It] was a long time ago! But I...remember it clearly. It was very special." "My birthday falls on February 5, and I...signed my first film, 'Refugee' with Mr JP Dutta on February 1," he added. "I was sure at 23 I wanted to become an actor," said Abhishek.

369.title: I hope it doesn't affect Jadeja: Irfan Pathan on CSK captaincy change
369.article_body: Reacting to all-rounder Ravindra Jadeja handing back CSK captaincy to MS Dhoni after six defeats in their eight games in the ongoing IPL season, former India all-rounder Irfan Pathan said, "I really feel for Jadeja." Irfan added, "Let's hope it doesn't affect him as a cricketer in a negative way." Jadeja has scored 112 runs in the season so far.

370.title: New Zealand reports first case of Omicron BA.4 variant of COVID-19
370.article_body: New Zealand reported its first known case of Omicron BA.4 variant of COVID-19 after a person who had travelled from overseas tested positive for it, said the country's Ministry of Health on Sunday. Nearly 12,700 community cases were also detected during the weekend, it added. Two other sub-variants of Omicron were also detected in two overseas returnees.

371.title: Not a bad idea: Musk on using Dogecoin to authenticate humans on Twitter
371.article_body: Elon Musk, who is acquiring Twitter for $44 billion, said it's "not a bad idea" to use Dogecoin to authenticate humans on Twitter. He was responding to billionaire investor Mark Cuban's idea of Twitter users putting up one Dogecoin for unlimited posts. "If anyone contests a post and humans confirm it's spam, they get the spammer's Doge," the investor said.

372.title: Matter of pride for me to lead Indian Army: General Manoj Pande
372.article_body: A day after taking charge, Army Chief General Manoj Pande said it's a matter of pride for him that he has been asked to lead Indian Army. "It has a glorious past that maintained the security and integrity of the nation," he said. The Army chief added, "The geopolitical situation is changing rapidly and we have many challenges before us."

373.title: It was challenging to perform courtroom scene with Big B: Rakul on Runway 34
373.article_body: Actress Rakul Preet Singh spoke about the challenges she faced during the filming of 'Runway 34', where she had to act in front of actor Amitabh Bachchan. She said, "Most challenging part was to perform the courtroom scene with Mr. Bachchan." "I had to show the tension and vulnerability without showing any retaliation or dialogues at the beginning," she added.

374.title: Some residents in Mumbai to be trained in disaster management
374.article_body: The Brihanmumbai Municipal Corporation (BMC) said that it plans to provide disaster management training to people living in landslide-prone areas. Since many of these landslide-prone locations have access issues and nearby residents are first responders to calamities, training them will help in saving lives, it added. In 2021, over 290 landslide-prone areas were identified in Mumbai by the BMC.

375.title: Won’t allow any loss of territory: New Army chief on standoff with China
375.article_body: Army Chief General Manoj Pande, while talking about the standoff with China along the Line of Actual Control, said Indian troops are holding important physical positions. "We are very clear that we'll not permit any change in the status quo and any loss of territory," he added. He further said, "We have re-aligned our troops after carrying out threat assessments."

376.title: Impressed with planning of 2032 Brisbane Olympics Games: IOC Prez
376.article_body: International Olympic Council (IOC) President Thomas Bach has said that he is "impressed" with the commencement of the planning of the 2032 Olympic Games in Brisbane. "[O]ff to a really wonderful start...We are extremely impressed by the quality of the board of the organising committee, by the diversity," Bach said after IOC's first meeting with Brisbane organisers.

377.title: My favourite designer called me to his hotel room, we had sex: Saisha Shinde
377.article_body: Saisha Shinde revealed on 'Lock Upp' that a designer once invited her to his hotel room. She said, "This is one secret that I never brought out. This Indian designer was my favourite. He called me to his hotel room, I hugged him, and...we had sex." "He had done the same with at least 7 to 8 boys," Saisha added.

378.title: He's bashing the door down as hard as he can: Steyn on Rahul Tripathi
378.article_body: SRH bowling coach Dale Steyn has praised batter Rahul Tripathi for his performance in the IPL, stating that the 31-year-old is "bashing the [Team India] door down as hard as he can". Steyn added, "The way Tripathi is playing and the way he has played, he has certainly matured." Rahul has scored 228 runs in eight games in IPL 2022.

379.title: 5 Galgotias University students hit by car in Greater Noida, 1 dead
379.article_body: Out on their evening walk, five students of Galgotias University were hit by a speeding vehicle in Greater Noida on Saturday. According to the police, one of them, identified as Ayush Sharma (23), died during the treatment at the Kailash Hospital while four others are still recovering from their injuries. Notably, the police officials are searching for the unidentified accused.

380.title: US woman gets 2-yr felony probation for casting dead mother’s vote
380.article_body: A 64-year-old woman has been sentenced to two years of felony probation for voting her dead mother's ballot in US' Arizona in the 2020 general election. Her mother had died days before election. She was also fined and asked to perform community service, which was more lenient than what the prosecutor had sought - at least 30 days in jail.

381.title: Pak secures $8 bn financial aid from Saudi amid economic crisis: Reports
381.article_body: Amid an economic crisis in Pakistan, the country has secured financial support worth $8 billion from Saudi Arabia, multiple reports said on Sunday. The deal was secured during Pakistan PM Shahbaz Sharif's visit to Saudi, local media reported. Pakistan has been battling a crisis with high inflation, reduced forex reserves, depreciating currency and a widening current account deficit.

382.title: If a film isn't a hit, people criticise it more than it deserves: Nawazuddin
382.article_body: When asked if there's any insecurity in Bollywood after the domination of films like 'RRR' and 'KGF 2', Nawazuddin Siddiqui said, "When a film does well everyone...praises it more than it...deserves. Similarly, if a film isn't a hit, people criticise it more than it deserves." "Now if a Bollywood film becomes a...hit then all these talks will change," he added.

383.title: China's COVID lockdown rules are cruel, we won’t follow them: Taiwan
383.article_body: Taiwan's Premier Su Tseng-chang has termed China's COVID-19 rules as "cruel", adding that country won't follow similar measures. Her comments come as Taiwan's experiencing a surge in COVID-19 cases with 17,085 new cases reported on Sunday. Notably, China enforced a stringent lockdown in Shanghai and had adopted measures such as erecting fences outside residential areas to arrest spread of virus.

384.title: Was told to lose weight for auditions, would leave Mumbai scarred: Flora Saini
384.article_body: Actress Flora Saini said that she was asked to lose weight for auditions and that she would leave Mumbai scarred. She also said that she has been rejected so many times and there is a lot of criticism in the industry. "People say, 'you've gained weight, you don't fit into the character'," she added.

385.title: Mumbai likely to receive pre-monsoon rainfall around May 12
385.article_body: Mumbai is likely to record pre-monsoon rainfall around May 12 due to low pressure in the Andaman sea. Heavy rains are likely in Eastern India in second week of May. A low pressure area is likely to form over the same region around May 6 and it is likely to become more marked during subsequent 24 hours.

386.title: My character in Modern Love is something I've attempted for first time: Fatima
386.article_body: Speaking about the response she garnered for the trailer of her upcoming show, 'Modern Love: Mumbai' actress Fatima Shaikh said, "The response that has been coming my way after the trailer release of...'Modern Love'...is sweet and encouraging." "My character in 'Modern Love' is something I've attempted for the...first time and this anthology is very close to my heart," she added.

387.title: ISMC to invest ₹22,900 cr to set up India's 1st chip-making plant in K'taka
387.article_body: International semiconductor consortium ISMC will invest ₹22,900 crore ($3 billion) to set up India's first and largest semiconductor fabrication unit in Karnataka, the state government announced on Sunday. ISMC is a joint venture between Abu Dhabi's Next Orbit Ventures and Israel's Tower Semiconductor. The chip-making plant is expected to generate over 1,500 direct and 10,000 indirect jobs.

388.title: World may face a recession within the next two years, warns Singapore PM
388.article_body: Singapore PM Lee Hsien Loong has warned that the world may face a recession within the next two years. Loong said that the Russia-Ukraine war has clouded Singapore's post-COVID-19 recovery outlook, adding that Singaporeans are already feeling the impact of the war on the cost of living. Singapore is facing an S$8 billion hit a year from higher energy prices.

389.title: Man dressed as sadhu sexually assaults 12-yr-old girl in Jharkhand
389.article_body: A 12-year-old girl was allegedly sexually assaulted in Jharkhand's Khunti district by a man, who visited her house in the guise of a sadhu to seek offerings, police said on Sunday. Three men dressed as sadhus visited the girl's house and the main accused went inside to drink water when the girl ran out of the house screaming, police said.

390.title: Indian-American Nand Mulchandani to be CIA's first-ever CTO
390.article_body: Indian-American entrepreneur Nand Mulchandani has been named the US government's Central Intelligence Agency's (CIA) first-ever Chief Technology Officer (CTO). Mulchandani is a serial entrepreneur who has co-founded and been CEO of startups namely Oblix, Determina, OpenDNS and ScaleXtreme. He has studied at Cornell University, Stanford Business School and Harvard's Kennedy School of Government.

391.title: Was very nervous, he made me comfortable: Sethupathi on working with Shahid
391.article_body: Vijay Sethupathi, who'll be seen sharing screen space with Shahid Kapoor in the show 'Farzi', spoke about working with Shahid and said, "I was very nervous since I had to shoot with Shahid...on the...first day." "But he made me...comfortable, especially since he'd already shot for 'Farzi' for 40 days," Vijay added. The show is being directed by Raj & DK.

392.title: Masks will be compulsory in Maha again if COVID-19 cases rise: Tope
392.article_body: Maharashtra Health Minister Rajesh Tope said on Sunday that the state will bring back its compulsory mask mandate if COVID-19 cases continue to rise. His comments come after Maharashtra CM Uddhav Thackeray appealed to people to wear masks outdoors to restrict a possible "fourth wave" of COVID-19 infections. Maharashtra government made wearing masks optional for residents last month.

393.title: Don't believe permanent ban is right: Ex-Twitter CEO Dorsey
393.article_body: Ex-Twitter CEO Jack Dorsey, in an apparent hint to the permanent suspension of Donald Trump's Twitter account in 2021, said he doesn't believe that any permanent ban, with the exception of illegal activity, is right. A "transparent system", both in policy and operations, is more important than whether Twitter is run by a company or an open protocol, Dorsey added.

394.title: LIC to retain some stake in IDBI Bank for bancassurance gains: Chairman
394.article_body: LIC will retain a part of its stake in IDBI Bank to reap the benefits of the bancassurance channel, Chairman MR Kumar said. He added that LIC doesn't want to "hold a big stake" but some holding as it has been a win-win for both entities. LIC had bought a 51% stake in IDBI Bank in 2019 for ₹21,624 crore.

395.title: Man wearing Zomato t-shirt, 2 teenagers killed in car-bike crash in Delhi
395.article_body: Three people, including a motorcycle rider wearing a Zomato t-shirt, died in an accident involving a car and a motorcycle in Delhi. Other two deceased have been identified as 17-year-old Jyoti and her 19-year-old sister Bharti. Police said the motorcycle was in front of the car but the sequence of events leading to the accident is yet to be established.

396.title: It's going to take some time: Producer Barbara on casting next James Bond
396.article_body: James Bond producer Barbara Broccoli said in an interview that "it's going to take some time" before Daniel Craig's replacement is named. "It's a big decision. It's not just casting a role. It's about a whole rethink about where we're going," Barbara said. 'No Time To Die', which was released in 2021, marked Daniel's final outing as the 007 agent.

397.title: Mumbai Police capable of maintaining peace in city: Commissioner
397.article_body: Mumbai Police Commissioner Sanjay Pandey on Saturday said that the city's police force is capable enough to deal with people who try to disturb the peace. He also sought the cooperation of residents in maintaining the law and order. Notably, Pandey's comments come after MNS chief Raj Thackeray's ultimatum to remove loudspeakers in mosques by May 3.

398.title: CCTV footage of Noida mall fight that led to 30-year-old man's death released
398.article_body: CCTV footage of the Gardens Galleria fight that led to the death of a 30-year-old man has surfaced. In the video, staff and bouncers of the Lost Lemons resto-bar in Noida outside which the fight took place, are seen beating one person. The fight allegedly broke out on April 25 over the bill and resulted in Brijesh Rai's death.

399.title: Me, Suryakumar wanted to take chase vs RR as deep as possible: Tilak
399.article_body: After MI's five-wicket win against RR in IPL 2022, MI batter Tilak Varma said that he and teammate Suryakumar Yadav wanted to take the 159-run chase as deep as possible. Tilak (35) and Suryakumar (51) posted an 81-run third-wicket stand and helped MI register their first win this season following eight consecutive losses. MI scored 161/5 in 19.2 overs.

400.title: PV Sindhu argues with chair umpire and chief referee over point penalty, video goes viral
400.article_body: A video went viral showing Indian shuttler PV Sindhu arguing with the chair umpire and chief referee after being given one point penalty for taking time to serve in her Badminton Asia Championships semi-final against Japan's Akane Yamaguchi. Sindhu argued that Yamaguchi "wasn't ready" but officials stayed with their decision. Sindhu, who was leading at the time, lost the match.

401.title: Kuldeep is thriving in DC's positive environment: Ponting
401.article_body: DC head coach Ricky Ponting has said the positive environment provided by the franchise is helping spinner Kuldeep Yadav to thrive in the ongoing season. Ponting added, "We're really pleased for him...and [making] sure we keep things in line with him and not let him get too far ahead of himself." Currently, Kuldeep is the second-highest wicket-taker in IPL 2022.

402.title: DMK stands for upliftment of workforce: TN CM Stalin on Labour Day
402.article_body: Speaking at an event on International Labour Day in Chennai, Tamil Nadu CM MK Stalin said on Sunday that the DMK government stands for the upliftment of the workforce. "It is...DMK...that brought the use of bicycle rickshaws instead of hand-pulled rickshaws...For the first time in India, the DMK government provided free electricity to farmers in [Tamil Nadu]," he added.

403.title: Russian chiefs don't tell soldiers about expected losses: Zelenskyy
403.article_body: Ukrainian President Volodymyr Zelenskyy on Saturday claimed that Russian commanders are lying to their soldiers and don't tell them about new losses expected. He alleged that they're not told that Russian army is preparing additional refrigerator trucks for "storing the bodies". "It's better for you to survive in Russia than to perish on our land," he said to Russian soldiers.
